main event: On July 29, 1948, in the Northeastern part of Indianapolis, Indiana, at approximately 0955 hours, two observers witnessed a broad, short propeller-shaped object, approximately 6-8 feet long and 2 feet wide, flying just above the treetops at 30 feet altitude, gliding at 25-30 mph with no apparent spinning motion and no discernible sound. The object appeared to be aluminum or shiny in color and was in a slight descent as it headed south in a bank to the left.
interesting points: The object was sighted just above the trees at approximately 30 feet altitude, gliding with no apparent spinning motion, and traveling at 25-30 mph.
The witnesses observed the object in excellent weather conditions with no clouds in the sky.
The object had a broad, short propeller shape, approximately 6-8 feet long, with each blade approximately 2 feet wide and 1 foot thick, and appeared to be aluminum or shiny in color.
The witnesses were employees of a company in Indianapolis, and no photographs of the object were available for documentation.
An investigation and search of the area where the object was believed to have fallen did not produce any results, as the area was densely wooded with many hills and valleys.
sighted object: Broad, short propeller-shaped object approximately 6-8 feet long and 2 feet wide, aluminum or shiny in color
witnesses: Two witnesses employed by a company in Indianapolis
